name: Inn at the Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for three nights and were delighted with our hotel choice. The staff was very polite, helpful and friendly. We loved the elegant ambiance: marble floors, gilt mirrors, crown mouldings, etc. The kingsize bed was very comfortable with a thick mattress, lots of pillows and a nice plush comforter. We used the full kitchen and dining room quite a bit and saved a lot on meals. I was a little concerned that there was no a/c, but with windows that actually opened, high ceilings and a ceiling fan, none was needed. The location overlooking Balboa Park and about eight blocks from the Hillcrest shopping/dining area was very convenient. Everything was clean and the housekeeping service was very good. The bathroom was antiquated, but everything worked just fine. The huge bath towels and English toiletries provided were a nice surprise. There was a dressing area, vanity and walk-in closet with lots of space. This hotel gives a lot of value: Large comfortable suites, free parking, free wi-fi, and continental breakfast with a breathtaking view are all included in the rate which was very reasonable for the San Diego area. We'll certainly be staying there again on our next visit and will recommend it to friends and family.
reviews.title: Historic Ambiance - Modern Convenience
Wonderful
reviews.text: This hotel is like a step in the past. If you want new and ultra modern, stay somewhere else but if you want style and friendly service, stay here. My sister and I just spent three nights in this

great hotel. We arrived Saturday late afternoon tired and irritable from a very eventful day in different airports. We found the front desk Very friendly and helpful. When I asked for a room with a view, they apologized and informed me the hotel was full but they would take care of it the next day. Although they couldn't help with the room, a free bottle of wine helped us over our disappointment. Sure enough Sunday mid morning, we were given the keys to our upgraded room. The rooms are great. Very large and clean with a nice size kitchen. The hotel is located right across the street from Balboa park and within walking distance of a Rite Aid drugstore and dozens of restaurants. My sister and I hit the Whole Foods grocery store about a mile from the hotel (we walked). They have not only a great deli but many appealing prepacked meals to go.
reviews.title: A welcomed Relief!

likes.liked: — size of the room and location

reviews.text: The hotel parking lot is small but found the side streets often available. My only complaint is the beds have no headboards...
reviews.title: You MUST Stay at the Park Manor

likes.liked: — Personal attention to guests, preservation of Old-

reviews.title: Nothing appears to have changed
reviews.text: makes sitting up in bed an exercise in pillow retrievel. A great hotel, very good and friendly service throughout our entire stay and overall, a great experience.

reviews.title: Uneven Quality - large rooms, poorly equipped kitchen
reviews.text: Ensure that you ask for a room away from the construction site (March 2007) - we paid extra for a balcony that turned over to overlook a worksite and were woken early every morning!

reviews.title: Lovely, Comfortable and Affordable
reviews.text: We booked this hotel specifically for the "fully equipped kitchen" and were disappointed. Vintage range without instructions, no equipment for oven cooking, not enough plug-ins (unplug fridge to use coffee maker). No cutting board, wine glasses and other essentials and very little countertop space.
Staff were friendly, and did supply a few things when asked. Good location for exploring Balboa Park.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs!!!

reviews.text: Everything in the suite was a bit tatty and drapes were unclean. Comfortable bed was the best feature. Room was hot even in March.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service, lots of character

likes.liked: — Fantastic service, large rooms, excellent view, quiet neighborhood

reviews.title: Fabulous Wedding Venue
reviews.text: The Park Manor Suites is lovely, old and charming. I found it to be a delightful experience. The location is the best in San Diego. It is between two major streets with easy access to the expressway, Balboa Park and to downtown harbor attractions. The views from the rooftop are stunning. If you go to this hotel expecting new and modern accomodations, then you will be disappointed, but if you, as I do, enjoy the ambiance of a 1920's hotel then you will have great time here. The bathrooms could use some upgrading and are small, but functional. The mattresses are definately on the firm side, but not uncomfortable. The kitchen and dining room are more than adequate and the living room is large and spacious, with plenty of seating room. There are plenty of closets.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night stay on a Monday in August 2006. I booked the Midweek Getaway through the "Specials" link on the hotel's website for $149 plus tax which incluses a Studio Suite, wine or champagne upon arrival in your room and $40 towards dinner at the hotel's restaurant downstairs. Champagne tasted cheap and the hotel restaurant is maybe a 2 or 3-star establishment with 4-star prices.
reviews.title: Definately not a cookie cutter type property
Quirky
reviews.text: I arrived very early (8am). The hotel staff was happy to hold my luggage and provide me with a parking permit for their lot while I spent the day in Balboa Park and the Zoo. I got lucky and there was one open space in the small lot when I arrived. Still, free parking is a great plus considering downtown hotels charge $20-30 a day to park.

reviews.title: Awesome once again
reviews.text: Check-in is the standard 3pm, but I was given a bit of a cold shoulder when I returned at 2:30pm and asked for my room. I was told it was still too early, but they gave me the room anyway.

reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon thanks to the Park and its staff
reviews.text: Not exactly sure why, but I was given a two-bedroom suite on the 6th floor instead of the studio I had booked. This was a pleasant surprise. I had asked for a room overlooking 6th Avenue since there is construction on the south side of the property near the parking lot, but was told all rooms had already been assigned.
My room overlooked the parking lot and Spruce Street. Construction was not an issue since we checked in as the crew was ending for the day and left early the next morning.
reviews.title: Be Warned!!!! No A/C

reviews.text: Excellent hotel in excellent location near Balboa park and Hillcrest.
reviews.title: excellent hotel- a must if in San Diego

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are great- the piano bar is very friendly and the rooms are amazingly large, clean and airy. I will not stay anywhere else if in SAn Diego again
reviews.title: What a get-away!

likes.disliked: — The couch and chair looked really old in the room.

reviews.text: Our plan was to arrive early Friday morning, we were attending a wedding later that afternoon, we were hoping to have a room ready prior to the wedding where we could shower and get dressed and not inconvenience our friends staying elsewhere with their kids.
reviews.title: Park Manor Suites--Bigger than my first apartment

reviews.text: Upon arriving on Friday morning, we picked up our car from FOX Rentals, my advice go elsewhere. Very unprofessional staff and the cars weren't very clean and not in the best of conditions. Not to mention the hidden price of the rental at the end... but that's beside the point... lets talk the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...needs some updating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had previously called and requested an early check-in, each time we were told to call the day of, but there weren't any guarantees. Working in the hospitality industry for over ten years I completely understood.
reviews.title: Can't say how good it was

likes.liked: — The ambiance and great comfort and versatility of the rooms.
likes.disliked: — Probably location, but with a car don't worry at all, it's 10 mins to everywhere!

aka: Inn At The Park Hotel San Diego
description: Located on the edge of Balboa Park and walking distance to the San Diego Zoo and the Old Globe Theatre it is a desirable starting point for your journey in this amazing city. When you stay with us make sure to try onsite dinning at our popular local restaurants, Inn at the Park Restaurant & Piano Bar and Top of the Park Penthouse Restaurant. At the Inn at the Park Restaurant you can experience creative Regional American Cuisine with a Southern California influence in an atmosphere reminiscent of a historic coastal inn. And when head up to the 7th floor Top of the Park Penthouse Restaurant you are served up San Diego's best panoramic views of the city, plus an extensive lunch menu featuring three daily signature quiche dishes and innovative salads. It also provides the perfect venue for weddings, events and meetings. Come see for yourself why Inn at the Park hotel is the perfect destination for your next California getaway.
